text:
The product we're building is
an AI-powered scam detector.
It's called Norton Genie.

So what it does is you
can easily upload an image
or a piece of text and ask Norton Genie
whether it's a scam or not.
It's a very complicated solution

because it involves
many integration points,
many many touch points, and multiple teams

actually working together
to bring this to the market.

So we choose AWS for its
ability to scale infinitely.

We pick the simplest
language to implement Lambda.
You're going from a hundred people

to a million users
without changing anything.

We don't have no scale up
because of what we're using,

serverless, AWS will take
care of all the stuff for us.

That's mostly the main
reason to go with AWS at this point.

We actually use Kinesis,
Kinesis Firehose as a way

of streaming data through for
a lot of backend processing.

The solution like this
is going to take six
to 12 months to build, traditionally.

Now it takes about three
months or even less.

So customers get to use
our product a lot sooner.
They can give us feedback in real time,

then we actually can fix
the bugs really quickly.
And everybody wins.
